result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Preliminary Hearing 11/9/22 at 3:30 PM
Standard felony conditions,  not leave the State of WI without prior written approval of the court, must report to the Columbia County Jail for fingerprinting and photographing.
Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:01 PM Defendant Mackaveli A Graham appeared by video, in custody from the Dodge county jail.  Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant received criminal complaint, right to attorney recited, $500.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, not leave the State of WI without prior written approval of the court, must report to the Columbia County Jail for fingerprinting and photographing. Court quashed warrant. 2:07 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm. Writ needed
